Metadata: Spatial variability in red sea urchin ("Strongylocent​rotus franciscanus") recruitment in northern California

Here the authors attempt to explain spatial variability in recruitment of red sea urchins ("Strongylocent​rotus franciscanus") in the context of mesoscale features of the circulation associated with two distinct promontories in northern California-​Point Reyes and Point Arena. They propose that areas subject to more frequent warming during upwelling relaxations will experience higher recruitment because larvae are retained in the non-upwelled, warmer water and transported to shore.
